identified-content.org: United States Military Academy (West Point, NY)

abstract.p: May 25 article about influence of war in Iraq on this year's graduating class at US Military Academy referred incorrectly to Brig Gen William B Kunzig Jr; Kunzig, 97, was oldest living graduate at ceremony, not oldest living graduate of West Point

block.p: An article on May 25 about the influence of the war in Iraq on this year's graduating class at the United States Military Academy referred incorrectly to Brig. Gen. William B. Kunzig Jr. of Minneapolis, an alumnus who was on campus for the annual alumni review. General Kunzig, 97, class of 1932, was the oldest living graduate at the ceremony, not the oldest living graduate of West Point. (According to the academy, that title belongs to Benjamin Whitehouse, 104, a retired colonel from Brewster, Mass., who graduated in 1927.)

An article on May 25 about the influence of the war in Iraq on this year's graduating class at the United States Military Academy referred incorrectly to Brig. Gen. William B. Kunzig Jr. of Minneapolis, an alumnus who was on campus for the annual alumni review. General Kunzig, 97, class of 1932, was the oldest living graduate at the ceremony, not the oldest living graduate of West Point. (According to the academy, that title belongs to Benjamin Whitehouse, 104, a retired colonel from Brewster, Mass., who graduated in 1927.)
